Explore our product!

What is Kuroco?

Kuroco is a headless CMS that both content managers and developers love. We provide an option to switch between Developer view and Content view to provide quick access to the features you find most relevant.

Modular content structures

Build a content structure to match your data from a rich selection of configurable data types. You can configure various constraints, defaults, or even group several types in one and repeat it several times - for example for a photo gallery containing 10 items having an image file and a text description each.

Customizable API

Kuroco allows you to be creative in the way to access and manipulate your data. Create a minimalistic API and add the endpoints you need to manipulate your content: allow users to update data, fetch only, allow editing for a specific user role, or add custom processing or hooks on update.

Easily add media

Kuroco offers rich data types for your content. You can upload and preview various media files, publish or save your content as draft, or even schedule a publishing period.

Built to be scalable

There is no limit to the amount of content structures or content you can create. Kuroco uses optimized data structures and queries to instantly list and paginate hundreds of thousands of contents.

Configurable dashboard

Choose from a selection of widgets to display the information you need on your personal dashboard, such as update history, cost, various metrics, and more.

Features that developers like

Configurable API

Set up your OpenAPI 3-compatible, highly customizable API by creating endpoints from a wide selection of provided features and methods.

Modular Content Structures

Build content structures tailored to your data by combining rich and configurable data types such as Text, Date, File and more.

Speed

Rapidly serve your centralized content
to any device using cacheable API endpoints, served through CDN.

Ease of use

We are proud of our simple and intuitive user interface and our extensive, community-driven documentation.

Powerful customization

Combine API calls, connect to external services, or create your own services using custom API scripting features.
